m_szDocSumamry: Thin and Flexible Glass from Penn State Suited for Ultracapacitor Applications Ovidiu Sandru July 23, 2013 Energy Storage A new type of glass developed at Penn State promises better energy storage technologies that could power future hybrid and electric cars in the future. Glass is a dielectric material, which means electrons don’t pass easily between two of its surfaces. This property makes glass (and other dielectrics) suited for capacitor applications, where its  two sides get polarized (positive and negative), and hold an electric potential between them.
